p: Among the aromatic plants whose essential oils are extracted, a promising candidate is an endemic savanna tree, widely distributed in Brazil, that belongs to the family Anacardiaceae: Myracrodruon urundeuva (Aroeira of the backwoods) [ 23]. This plant has been noted for its antimicrobial potential, which was evidenced when molecules obtained from crude extracts of M. urundeuva were found to have antibacterial and antifungal properties [ 24â€“ 27]. Additionally, other studies indicate antiparasitic [ 28], analgesic and anti-inflammatory properties [ 29], encouraging research on the possible uses for this substance in herbal medicine.
